description: Change of use from Use Class C3 (dwelling house) to Use Class Sui Generis (HMO - house in multiple occupation) including rear to side dormer and front roof lights.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of the decision notice. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Location Plan - PR L001 - Rev APR P001 - Rev APR P002 - Rev APR P003 - Rev APR P004 - Rev APR E001 - Rev APR E002 - Rev APR E003 - Rev APR E004 - Rev APR L002 - Rev APR L003 - Rev APR S001 - Rev APR S002 - Rev AHighway Impact Assessment Sustainable DrainageReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
The external finishing materials shall match those used in the construction of the existing building and/or areas of hard surfacing. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance.

Prior to occupation, unless otherwise agreed cycle parking should be provided in compliance with the following criteria:o	Provision of a minimum of EIGHT long stay cycle parking spaceso	in an accessible location: the access route to the store should be a minimum of 1.2m wide to enable the bike to enter the store, should be step free and involve no more than 2 doors or gates (excluding the store door) which must also have a minimum opening width of 1.2mo	secured: with a British Standard mortice lock or access fobo	fully enclosed: 4 walls and a roofReason: The Council's Climate Action and Transport Policies seek to increase the use of active and sustainable transport modes. This means that access to bicycle parking should be easy and secure to remove potential barriers to cycling.

Prior to first occupation details of the design of refuse storage facilities including facilities for the recycling of waste to satisfy the future number of occupiers on site, shall be provided within the development, in accordance with the Household Recycling and Waste Planning Guidance for New Developments (2024).In particular, waste collection vehicles must be able to get within 25m of the refuse storage point. Residents should not have to carry waste further than 30m.Reason: In order to facilitate efficient, safe and clean removal of household refuse, the location and accessibility of refuse storage plus to maintain safety on the Highway.

The use of the property as a House in Multiple Occupation hereby approved shall be occupied by a maximum of 8 people at any one time and shall not be subdivided or occupied as self-contained units.Reason: To accord with the stipulations of definition as a House of Multiple Occupation and to safeguard the residential character of the surrounding area.

No independent cooking or laundry facilities shall be installed in any of the respective bedrooms, and the communal kitchen /  dining room shall be retained as such in perpetuity.Reason: To accord with the stipulations of definition as a House of Multiple Occupation and to safeguard the residential character of the surrounding area.

Prior to occupation, a Flood Evacuation Report must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The report must demonstrate:o That a dry access route is provided within the low hazard area of the floodplain (as defined by the Environment Agency's Flood Risk Assessment Guidance for New Development - R&D Technical Report FD2320). As Chase Side Crescent is subject to flooding in the 1-in-100-year +17% climate change event, the escape route must avoid this area in extreme conditions.o That safe refuge is available above ground level for all occupants at all times.To minimise flood risk in accordance with Policy CP28 of the Core Strategy, Policy SI12 of the London Plan, DMD Policies 59, 60, and 62, the Strategic Flood Risk Assessment, and the NPPF.
